snippet: The final of the trial to select the U.S. open team for the World Mind Sports Games.
abstract: Phillip Alder Bridge column on deal played during the final of the trial to select the United States open team for the World Mind Sports Games. Diagram (M)
lead_paragraph: The final of the trial to select the United States open team for the World Mind Sports Games looked, on Friday afternoon, as though it would be a battle between the top seed, Nick Nickell-Ralph Katz, Bob Hamman-Zia Mahmood and Jeff Meckstroth-Eric Rodwell; and the second seed, John Diamond-Brian Platnick, Fred Gitelman-Brad Moss and Eric Greco-Geoff Hampson. After 90 of the 120 boards in the semifinals, the Nickell team led Reese Milner-Hemant Lall, Kevin Bathurst-Justin Lall and John Kranyak-Gavin Wolpert by 249 international match points to 173.

headline.main: U.S. Final for World Mind Sports Games
